MCQ: What is the scientific study of life known as?
Choices: a: Chemistry | b: Biology | c: Physics | d: Geology

MCQ: Which of the following is a major theme in biology?
Choices: a: All organisms can perform mathematical calculations. | b: All organisms are made up of cells that process hereditary information. | c: All organisms live independently without interacting with their environment. | d: All organisms are static and unchanging through time.

MCQ: What process is important to life as it allows organisms to move, grow, and reproduce?
Choices: a: Water cycling | b: Carbon dating | c: Energy processing | d: Mineral collection

MCQ: Biologists study life at multiple levels of organization. Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a level of study?
Choices: a: Molecular biology of a cell | b: Anatomy and physiology of plants and animals | c: Evolution of populations | d: Astrophysical phenomena of celestial bodies

MCQ: How many years ago did life on Earth emerge?
Choices: a: More than 1.5 billion years ago | b: More than 2.5 billion years ago | c: More than 3.7 billion years ago | d: More than 4.5 billion years ago
